The 'Wittelsbach' family is a European royal family and a German dynasty
from Bavaria.

Members of the family served as Dukes, Electors and Kings of Bavaria
(1180â1918), Counts Palatine of the Rhine (1214â1803 and 1816â1918), Margraves
of Brandenburg (1323â1373), Counts of Holland, Hainaut and Zeeland (1345â1432),
Elector-Archbishops of Cologne (1583â1761), Dukes of JÃ¼lich and Berg
(1614â1794/1806), Kings of Sweden (1441â1448 and 1654â1720) and Dukes of Bremen-
Verden (1654â1719).

The family also provided two Holy Roman Emperors (1328/1742), one King of the
Romans (1400), two Anti-Kings of Bohemia (1619/1742), one King of Hungary
(1305), one King of Denmark and Norway (1440) and one King of Greece
(1832â1862).

The family's head, since 1996, is Franz, Duke of Bavaria.
